abstract: The company argued that if it were forced to buy back bad mortgages, even more people would lose their homes.
snippet: The company argued that if it were forced to buy back bad mortgages, even more people would lose their homes.
lead_paragraph: Bank of America on Thursday rebuffed claims by a lawyer for several big investors, including the Federal Reserve Bank of New York, that it should buy back troubled mortgages because the loans were made improperly.

headline.main: Bank of America Fights Pressure on Mortgages
headline.print_headline: Bank of America Fights Pressure on Mortgages

abstract: Bank of America rebuffed claims by a lawyer for several big investors that it should buy back troubled mortgages because the loans were made improperly.
snippet: Bank of America rebuffed claims by a lawyer for several big investors that it should buy back troubled mortgages because the loans were made improperly.
lead_paragraph: Bank of America on Thursday rebuffed claims by a lawyer for several big investors, including the Federal Reserve Bank of New York and Pimco, that it should buy back troubled mortgages because the loans were made improperly, The New York Times reports.

headline.main: BofA Rejects Calls to Buy Back Mortgages

keywords.value: Federal Reserve Bank of New York

abstract: JPMorgan Chase expects to start refiling foreclosure documents in a couple of weeks, according to Charlie Scharf, chief executive of retail financial services.
snippet: JPMorgan Chase expects to start refiling foreclosure documents in a couple of weeks, according to Charlie Scharf, chief executive of retail financial services.
lead_paragraph: JPMorgan Chase expects to start refiling foreclosure documents in a couple of weeks, according to Charlie Scharf, chief executive of retail financial services, Reuters reports.

headline.main: JPMorgan to Resume Foreclosures This Month

abstract: The top United States banks could face up to $31 billion in losses from buying back bad mortgages, Standard & Poor’s said in a report on Thursday.
snippet: The top United States banks could face up to $31 billion in losses from buying back bad mortgages, Standard & Poor’s said in a report on Thursday.
lead_paragraph: The top United States banks could face up to $31 billion in losses from buying back bad mortgages, Standard & Poor’s said in a report on Thursday, Reuters reports.

headline.main: Banks Face $31 Billion Loss on Mortgage Buybacks

abstract: BofA’s mortgage-backed “doublespeak”; Twitter diplomacy; and the catastrophe calculator.
snippet: BofA’s mortgage-backed “doublespeak”; Twitter diplomacy; and the catastrophe calculator.
lead_paragraph: –James Kwak criticizes Bank of America for mortgage-backed “doublespeak.”

abstract: Citigroup and Bank of America disclosed investor lawsuits to force them to buy back soured mortgages, while Wells Fargo said it could not estimate the losses from these cases.
snippet: Citigroup and Bank of America disclosed investor lawsuits to force them to buy back soured mortgages, while Wells Fargo said it could not estimate the losses from these cases.

headline.main: Banks Brace for Costly Fights Over Mortgage Mess
